articles.title: Welcome
articles.description:
I'm a postdoctoral research fellow at [Economic and Social Research Institute (ESRI)](https://www.esri.ie/) in Dublin, Ireland. I work on economics relevant to climate change. In particular, I am interested in modeling and estimating climate change impacts, designing mitigation policies, and their specific implications for agriculture.
    
I completed my PhD in economics at UMR [Paris Saclay Applied Economics (PSAE)](https://www6.versailles-grignon.inrae.fr/economie_publique) in September 2021, advised by Stéphane De Cara (INRAE). See [here](https://youtu.be/vWFyfjOkVGk?t=27197) for a brief presentation
of my PhD in French.
articles.contents:
Curriculum
2021- Postdoctoral research fellow at Economic and Social Research Institute (ESRI)
2017-2021 PhD candidate at Paris Saclay Applied Economics (PSAE). Advisor: Stéphane De Cara
2017-2021 Assistant lecturer at ENS Paris-Saclay.
2016-2017 Visiting student at Motu (Wellington, New Zealand).
2015-2016 Master 2, Université Paris Saclay, Economie de l’énergie de l’environnement et des transports.
2014-2015 Master 1, Economie Théorique et Empirique, Université Paris 1.
Link for detailed CV
For the list of publications, see the Research page.

articles.description: Research interests: Climate change mitigation and adaptation, agriculture, microeconomics and applied modeling
